Module Simulator
Package kin.dyn

Class LinearMotorComponent

java.lang.Object
kin.dyn.Component
kin.dyn.LinearMotorComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controllable, FixSidePart, Identifiable, TailSidePart, LinearMotor, Motor
public class LinearMotorComponent
extends Component
implements TailSidePart, FixSidePart, LinearMotor, Identifiable, Controllable
A dynamic linear motor component.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Method Details

    • setDefaultMotorLength

      public void setDefaultMotorLength()
      Immediatly set the default motor length. It is not reasonable to call this method during a running simulation, as it sets the length in zero-time, i.e. with infinite speed. This method is only useful to reset a simulation.

      public void setTargetLength​(double targetLength)

      public double currentSpeedPortion()
      Description copied from interface: Motor
      Return the current speed in relative to min and max flexible speed. Note that 0.0 also means 'not moving' or 'no flexible speed'.
      Specified by:

      public void tickSimulation​(long deltaMillis)

      Overrides:
      tickSimulation in class Component
      Parameters:

    • setControllableValue

      public void setControllableValue​(double value)
      Description copied from interface: Controllable
      Set the controllable value. Set the value immediately. This is not the usual method, as it sets the value with infinite speed. This method is only used for interal numerical computations.
      Specified by:
      setControllableValue in interface Controllable
      Parameters:
      value - a measure for the respective compenent, i.e. radians for servo angles

    • setMotorLength

      public void setMotorLength​(double length)

      Set the motor's length immediately. This is not the usual method, as it sets the length with infinite speed. For 'natural' setting a target length as used for a real motor, use setTargetLength(double). This method is only used for interal numerical computations.

      Parameters:
      length - motor length

    • supportedValue

      public boolean supportedValue​(double value)
      Description copied from interface: Motor
      Detects, whether the given value is allowed by this motor, i.e.
      • not NaN
      • inside the range of supported values
      Specified by:
      supportedValue in interface Motor
      Parameters:
      value - motor value
      Returns:
      true if allowed

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(double motorSpeed, boolean exceptionIfLimitsExceeded)
      Description copied from interface: Motor
      Set the motor speed. This is only supported, if this motor supports flexible motor speeds.
      Specified by:
      setSpeed in interface Motor
      Parameters:
      motorSpeed - speed
      exceptionIfLimitsExceeded - if true an exception is thrown if the speed limits are exceeded; if false, the speed is always mapped to the valid range

    • setMotorSpeed

      public void setMotorSpeed​(double motorSpeed, boolean exceptionIfLimitsExceeded)
      Description copied from interface: LinearMotor
      Set the motor speed. This is only supported, if this motor supports flexible motor speeds.
      Specified by:
      setMotorSpeed in interface LinearMotor
      Parameters:
      motorSpeed - speed in cm per second
      exceptionIfLimitsExceeded - if true an exception is thrown if the speed limits are exceeded; if false, the speed is always mapped to the valid range

    • secondsToTarget

      Description copied from interface: Motor
      Get the estimated time in seconds to reach a target.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      length - target value
      which - speed indicator, 0: current speed, 1: default speed, 2: maximum speed, 3: minimum speed
      Returns:
      seconds
